OOC:  I couldn't have said that better!  Thank you for clearing that up!
  =
----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jonathan 
  To: nbwrpg@...=
m 
  Sent: Thursday, February 07, 2002 9:52 PM
  Subject: Re: Amoeba


  (O=
OC)

  /rant mode on

  To clear things up a bit before the kindegarden rej=
ects get sent to the corner:

  1) a single celled anything would not have =
a pupose. To have purpose you have to be self aware which said organisms ar=
e not.

  2) No a single celled organism could not exist in space. While it=
 doesn't need to breath it still needs to absorb material to survive. Space=
 dust is not going to keep it alive...if the radiation in space doesn't kil=
l it instantly.

  3) If you're going to have a "ghostly" entity floating a=
bout at least do some research on previous occurances. Starscream happens t=
o be the prime example of this type of character. His spark for whatever re=
ason did not join the matrix when his body got slagged on multiple occassio=
ns. His spark roamed space "possessing" bots. This is the closest sensible =
thing I could compare this cutie crap to.

  4) Last but certainly least ca=
n you guys ever just agree to disagree and let the council settle an arguem=
ent instead of squabbling like spoiled children? I know rauq and the others=
 must be busy but getting 50 odd emails, 90% of which is a bitch fest back =
and forth is annoying.

  /end rant mode
    ----- Original Message ----- 
=
    From: Jeepers Creepers 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Thurs=
day, February 07, 2002 11:10 PM
    Subject: Amoeba


    OOC:  Yes, they a=
re a single cell, just like your brain dewboy, and no they can't survive in=
 space.  They still need to thrive off of certain Earthly things, you know.=
